channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: After break with Trump, Marjorie Taylor Greene will resign
item.description: Republican Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, an "America First" conservative who has clashed with President Trump and her party, said Friday she would resign from Congress Jan. 5, 2026.
item.content:encoded:
Republican Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, an "America First" conservative who has clashed with President Trump and her party, said Friday she would resign from Congress Jan. 5, 2026.

(Image credit: Daniel Heuer)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Trump and Mamdani appeared friendly in meeting despite previous political sparring
item.description: President Trump met Mayor Elect Zohran Mamdani in the Oval Office after weeks of fiery rhetoric. Mamdani called the meeting productive.
item.content:encoded: President Trump met Mayor Elect Zohran Mamdani in the Oval Office after weeks of fiery rhetoric. Mamdani called the meeting productive.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Zelenskyy suggests that Ukraine's relationship with U.S. is at risk over peace deal
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says his country must choose between "dignity" and U.S. support as peace deal deadline looms.
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says his country must choose between "dignity" and U.S. support as peace deal deadline looms.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: Coast Guard changes course, reclassifies swastikas and nooses as hate symbols
item.description: The Coast Guard is reacting to reports that it had downgraded swastikas, nooses and other hate symbols in its new harassment manual. A new policy debuted overnight.
item.content:encoded: The Coast Guard is reacting to reports that it had downgraded swastikas, nooses and other hate symbols in its new harassment manual. A new policy debuted overnight.
item.dc:creator: Steve Walsh

item.title: Jazz group Snarky Puppy collaborates with Metropole Orkest for new live album
item.description: For their new album, the expansive jazz group Snarky Puppy collaborated with Metropole Orkest. The live recording is the band's grandest feat yet.
item.content:encoded: For their new album, the expansive jazz group Snarky Puppy collaborated with Metropole Orkest. The live recording is the band's grandest feat yet.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: What's behind your phone cravings and how movement can replace them
item.description: What if moving felt better than scrolling on your phone? NPR's Life Kit explains how to get there.
item.content:encoded: What if moving felt better than scrolling on your phone? NPR's Life Kit explains how to get there.
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: Kid reporter has serious fun with Celtics
item.description: A young reporter from Sports Illustrated Kids asked Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla a question about having fun. His answer got people talking.
item.content:encoded: A young reporter from Sports Illustrated Kids asked Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla a question about having fun. His answer got people talking.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: House considers banning stock trading by members of Congress
item.description: A bipartisan group in the House is looking to ban lawmakers from trading individual stocks as part of an effort to increase accountability in Congress.
item.content:encoded: A bipartisan group in the House is looking to ban lawmakers from trading individual stocks as part of an effort to increase accountability in Congress.
item.dc:creator: Deirdre Walsh

item.title: These fans have sung their way to the National Women's Soccer League finals
item.description: The Washington Spirit takes on Gotham FC on Saturday in San Jose, Calif.
item.content:encoded:
The Washington Spirit takes on Gotham FC on Saturday in San Jose, Calif.

(Image credit: Luke Chávez)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Why Border Patrol is taking the lead in mass deportations
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with The Atlantic staff writer Nick Miroff about the increasing role of Customs and Border Protection officers in immigration enforcement operations.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with The Atlantic staff writer Nick Miroff about the increasing role of Customs and Border Protection officers in immigration enforcement operations.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Bartlam
